meanings.definition: To force a liquid into something
meanings.sent1: The doctor injected the medicine into the patient's arm.
meanings.sent2: She carefully injected the dye into the test tube.
meanings.sent3: The chef injected a burst of flavor into the bland soup.
meanings.sent4: His words injected hope into her heart like a shot of adrenaline.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic injected oil into the engine, making it run smoothly again.

meanings.definition: To introduce something new or different into a situation
meanings.sent1: The artist injected creativity into every project she worked on.
meanings.sent2: The comedian injected humor into the conversation effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist injected excitement into the story.
meanings.sent4: Her bold ideas injected a fresh perspective into the team's discussions.
meanings.sent5: The student injected enthusiasm into the group project, inspiring others to do their best.
